meanings.definition: Essential things, like food and clean water, that are needed for survival.
examples: People are facing a shortage of basics like flour.

meanings.definition: Tiring or heavy pressure on the mind.
examples: His friend's sickness is a strain on him.

images.alt: Man sitting on a bed with hand on head.
images.description: A man sits on the edge of a bed. He leans forward and has his hand on his forehead.
images.caption: Strain can cause headaches or stomach aches.

source.title: Young man in sleepwear suffering from headache in morning
source.author: Andrea Piacquadio

meanings.definition: The length or duration of something; an amount of time.
examples: The span of a day is 24 hours.

meanings.definition: The things that are left over or undone.
examples: The kids helped their parents by picking up the slack and doing the dishes when they came home from school.

images.alt: Photo of family working together at home.
images.description: Family members are in their home kitchen. Some people are setting the table. Other people are getting good ready.
images.caption: Each person helps to get dinner ready.

source.title: Family Setting the Table for Dinner
source.author: August de Richelieu

meanings.definition: Having a duty to deal with something or of having control over someone.
examples: It is the responsibility of the ship's captain to make sure the passenger and cargo are safe.
